website_summaries.verdict: Short-sleeved athletic jerseys with wicking, quick-dry fabric and quality workmanship.
pros: Attractive, lightweight jersey suitable for all kinds of outdoor sports
Made of advanced breathable fabric, maximizing ventilation and moisture-wicking for quick dry
Comes in 7 bright colors, and black, for high visibility and safety
cons: It is recommended that purchasers order one complete size up from what they normally wear

customer_reviews.title: More colors please!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the reviews here. I got a Large. I am 5'11 195lbs. It is sized pretty close to tech tshirts. I have only used it once, but it was for a Century ride. It has 3 pockets. I stuffed them full and rode all day. No problems in the workmanship. It is a really inexpensive jersey. I wish there were more colors because I would buy one of each.
customer_reviews.author: Jameson K.

customer_reviews.title: of which I am very particular as I do not like the jersey to flop in the wind
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for plain jerseys but did not want to pay $80 or more for premium (meaning high-priced) brands.I initially purchased only one Spotti jersey because I was not sure of the fit, of which I am very particular as I do not like the jersey to flop in the wind. I am 5'11" weight 175 lbs and ordered a men's medium based on sizing guidelines and other reviewers' inputs. It fit perfectly so I decided to order another short-sleeve and a long-sleeve jersey. I am pleasantly surprised by the Spotti products I have received. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Stuart G Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality Servive.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first shirt in hi-vis yellow. The fit was perfect and the fabric is exceptional. I liked this so much that I bought a white one. The white shirt was a little smaller than the yellow. I mentioned this to the company rep that reached out to see how I liked the product. They immediately offered to send me the next size up saying sometimes the manufacturer slightly varies the size by color. Rather than risking a xahirt that could be too large I suggested they send me one in hi-vis orange. It fits exactly like the yellow. I would definitely recommend this shirt. I am now looking at purchasing this shirt in long sleeves.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne D Duner

customer_reviews.title: Everything I was looking for in a riding shirt
customer_reviews.text: I like how breathable it is. It stays in place, no riding up. It is moisture wicking and keeps me cool despite being black. I love the pockets on the back for my phone and anything I would need to carry that is light. One word of caution, if you have a bigger phone like mine (iPhone plus) the phone will sag in the shirt slightly but I usually turn it on it’s side and it stays snug in there. I have hit some bumpy spots in the road and was worried about my phone flying out but never happened so far. I’m pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Magdala Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Cruddy sewing job...poor.
customer_reviews.text: This shirt is well-thought-out and very well made I have had at least 3 months use and there is no fading or rip or tear. I would recommend this product and I will be purchasing another one in the future. 4-9-2020 Bad news...cruddy sewing job...started to unravel. I would show picture but no option to show.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Sulkes

customer_reviews.title: What a Price
customer_reviews.text: Great price, fits just as expected. I have some riding shirts with this long zipper in the front that have that plastic thread on the zipper, very uncomfortable. This one does not have that problem, it is great for riding, the fabric keeps the sweat wicked away. the color is more of an orange that red as it appears in the photo but that OK, it a cool orange color. I think I'm going to order a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hopwood

customer_reviews.title: Can not beat this for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as I just needed another bike shirt. While wearing this you are very visible!! Which is what I needed for some areas of where I can bike, due to there not being the proper infrastructure. So high visibility is a must. Fit is good, used it in 90+ degrees sunny in Florida, with no wicking or breathability issues during a 2 to 3 hour ride. The 2 back pockets are big enough to hold some of your necessities. The elastic on the bottom is tight enough. Not the thinnest, unlike a Rogelli shirt, however not too heavy either. For the price and for under 4 hours rides it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: mccm

customer_reviews.title: A terrific, very functional, low cost cycling jersey!
customer_reviews.text: Got this cycling jersey in the mail from Amazon and the next day wore it for a 100 mile road bike trip. It performed beyond my expectations! It wicked away my body sweat for most of the ride and it was extremely comfortable! I was able to carry my phone in the rear, back pocket, and I was able to retrieve it while cycling without any issues. Just get the Jersey and you will be highly satisfied. I doubted it the first time I found it on Amazon because of the low cost, but I'm truly pleased I purchased it! No more expensive road cycling jersey's for me!
customer_reviews.author: Frado

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: A while back, I bought similar jerseys of the now-defunct Performance brand. Both jerseys have full zippers, and I can't get one of the zippers started. The end piece was poorly made and is screwed up now. The zipper on the other jersey is on its way toward the same problem. These Spotti jerseys have only half zippers, and so I expect those zippers to last a lot longer. The Spotti jerseys seem to have pretty well-made seams and the fabric looks durable enough. Hopefully I'll get a decent amount of wear out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Missing a detail
customer_reviews.text: I returned this jersey. It was a bit heavy for my taste as far as the material goes, but my main problem was the cut is not longer in the back, so when you are bent over riding, it pulls up over your shorts and exposes your back. I didn't think this would be a big deal until I wore it and it was annoying. I'm 6'5", so maybe if you aren't tall, it won't be a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Josh ollar

customer_reviews.title: My poor nipples
customer_reviews.text: I’ve got a curse when exercising (think Andy Bernard) so when running I apply some body glide on the nips to prevent chaffing. When riding, I usually don’t have to apply anything. My other jersey is a Pearl Izumi and I don’t have any issues. With this jersey, first ride out, chaffed up a storm. Second ride, applied some body glide and still had some light chaffing. Jersey fit well and breathed good but the fabric weave is poor quality and is not gentle to my tender nipples. Deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Luigi Vampa

customer_reviews.title: High-value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I recently became a jersey convert. The convenience of jersey pockets is hard to deny. Being able to unzip a jersey to cool off is enormously useful. I didn't know though, so I decided to start small and buy a really inexpensive jersey. This Spotti jersey is great. Sizing varied a little between the two that I bought, so you might need to experiment. For the price though, this is a great basic cycling jersey. It's like the Hanes t-shirt of jerseys.
customer_reviews.author: DTKindler

customer_reviews.title: Loved the bright yellow shirt for helping from getting run ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved the bright yellow shirt for helping from getting run over in my bike rides-so I ordered 1 more yellow and 2 of thie green along with a white and black shirt- The green is obviously made somewhere else - although they both show to be made in China with 100% polyester -as even after washing and drying the green is not wrinkle free -see the pictures below
customer_reviews.author: Found the Truth

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Got the orange and it's a really bright visible neon orange. Ordered a large and it fits me perfectly IMO (5'10, 40" chest, 32" waist). Good length, not tight but not loose. Pockets should be useful for snacks and my phone. My first cycling shirt and seems like a really good buy for the price. May have to order 1 or 2 more of these...
customer_reviews.author: KoreanGuy

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money, but make a better investment.
customer_reviews.text: Decent value for the money, but this product is definitely not built to last. The elastic on the bottom started to shred after just 20-30 washes (not a lot for a product you need to wash after every use). It’s also so thin my bib shorts straps show very clearly through the jersey. It has been fine in the NY summer heat (high 80s and humid), but not quality to last more than one season. Next time I’d spend more money and buy something built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Guy B

customer_reviews.title: All the features, but poor crafting.
customer_reviews.text: GOOD: Spacious back pockets, durable breathable material. Definitely moisture wicking: got caught in some heavy rain and dried out after five minutes in the sunshine. BAD: Would be a great buy, except that the shoulder seam on my left side was pinched in a half inch too much. Because of this, my sleeve rides up a little higher on that side and the material sticks up on my shoulder like a little horn. Not a big deal, but it bothers me on long rides. When you pay twenty dollars for a jersey, you should probably expect some quality control problems.
customer_reviews.author: Ender Kalibo

customer_reviews.title: Nice shirt with one major caveat
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6 foot 170 lbs athletic build. The arms, chest, and shoulders fit well. However, the shirt is incredibly long in the back. When you add a cell phone, wallet, energy bar, etc into the rear pockets the weight of these items causes them to sit super low. I don't care for the feel of this stuff sitting right on my buttcheeks (or lower). If they corrected this design flaw the shirt would be a winner. With my other cycling jerseys the rear pocket items tend to sit near the small of my back which feels more natural.
customer_reviews.author: jbravo

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough to Consider Long Sleeves
customer_reviews.text: My jersey looks and feels great. I have worn it in warm and cool weather. Even under my fleece it wicked sweat away from my body. My only complaints are, despite fitting my chest, arms, and torso it's too long. I'm 5'10' and just under 200lbs with an average athletic build. It extended past my cheeks. Second, the zipper left a black dye mark on the back of the jersey. That's not a deal breaker, it's not a dress shirt. I will say that, I like it enough to consider buying the long-sleeved offering.
customer_reviews.author: J. DavisTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great basic jersey for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Form and function over flash and fanfare. Well proportioned, comfortable, basic three-pocket jersey. Perfect length - Long in back, a little shorter in front. Three ample-sized pockets in back for wallet, phone, and other essentials. Could easily accomodate a lite snack and even a spare sew-up tire. Comfortable material stays cool and dry. Front neck zipper is long enouth to offer plenty of ventilation on hot summer days. Doesn't appear to have any loose threads or unraveling seams. At 6'1" 200 lbs with a 44 chest size size XL fits me perfectly. I recommend it highly!
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great MTB shirt
customer_reviews.text: My primary purpose was to get bright orange to wear in the mountains during fall hunting season, but after wearing my shirt, this will become my "go-to" mountain bike jersey. I bought a second one and will likely buy more. The cloth is incredibly comfortable and light-weight. Wicks away sweat. The pockets are great. The band at the bottom is just the right tension for me. I have an athletic fit and too often shirts get baggy at the bottom. The band keeps the shirt fitted to my body.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent jersey for all, even heavier riders
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, loose fit but not a parachute. For heavier cyclists this is a winner. Im 6,4. 240lbs previously an ironman prior to accident and worn many jerseys or tri tops. I bought xxl so i didnt feel constricted, and the fit is great. The 3 pockets are just big enough, the tail of the jersey sits lower as it should as not to ride up your waist. Zipper is sturdy, and no seams have caused any weird rubbing. I have the orange and black and love them both. I will buy again when i start to lose weight and need smaller jerseys
customer_reviews.author: IronManDad

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've wore this jersey on two rides for a total of 34 miles. It was cool and efficient. I'm torn on the half zipper. I like that it doesn't come apart at the bottom when unzipped, but it is incredibly difficult to get it off with out help when it is drenched in sweat and stuck to your back. That isn't the manufacturer's fault, just the physics of a tight sweaty shirt that has to go over your head. I may stick with full zippers on future purchases for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: I'll have another one, please ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting back into riding after seven years on my feet. I ordered this yellow Spotti jersey as part of the campaign to get the right gear in place without breaking the bank. After a first ride, I immediately ordered a blue one. The amazing price does not conceal poor material, design or manufacturing. The look is simple and efficient, as I expected. The fit was as expected, as was the comfort level. You can go all the way up with the half-length zipper, but it locks in place just as well at half mast. The back pockets worked perfectly for both phone and water bottle. I'm having seconds.
customer_reviews.author: David A. BaerTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Wears well, washes easily
customer_reviews.text: The yellow short sleeve version fits well (I'm 5'4", 122 lbs). It is tagless and washes/dries easily. I also have one in green (tagless with black rubberized grip around waist), blue (tagless), red (tagless), and orange (has a tag and black rubberized grip around waist). Easy to peel off inside-out. The red version runs big, fits more like a medium than small.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C. Niederhoffer

customer_reviews.title: Great jersey for the price...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Spotti Basics Jersey as I definitely needed at least one new jersey. It fits as expected (not skin tight), as I ordered a medium and I usually take medium t-shirts. I've worn it on several rides so far, including a fifty-miler yesterday and the shirt was comfortable and appreciated in the humidity. I'm pleased so far and intend to order a second one. Update Sept 21: the jersey was comfortable on longer 4-5 hour rides in humid weather and so far still no problems with seams or stitching. The downside to a loose-fitting jersey, though, is that bees can make it inside if the zipper is down a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Russ in PA

customer_reviews.title: Feel The Cool Air Penetrating The Mesh Fabric
customer_reviews.text: The Spotti Men's Basic Short Sleeve Cycling Jersey, is great value for money. I am 5' 7" and about 150 lbs, I ordered a size large and it fits perfect. It looks and feels great with my thermal cycling jacket. As my body starts to heat up, unzipping my jacket, I soon feel the cool air penetrating through the mesh fabric of the Spotti Men's Cycling Jersey. A fabulous addition are the three pockets in the back of the jersey for your phone, or keys. I now own a Spotti Men's Long Sleeve and Short Sleeve Cycling Jersey. Regards Stephen.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen and Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Great color and torso length, arm length a little short
customer_reviews.text: I love the zipper only half way down the front, no more broken zippers that pop open the cycling jersey! The orange color is really bright and visible. The torso length is really long, but I like it as it doesn't ride up. The major drawback of this jersey is the lack of sleeve grabbers so the sleeves ride up and they seem to be shorter than other riding jerseys so they end up bunching up on my shoulder. Very breathable.
customer_reviews.author: Florida MTBer

customer_reviews.title: 5'10 200lbs XL
customer_reviews.text: I wasnt expecting much from this shirt but honestly its great. Keeps me cool while riding. I live in the deep humid south so cool comfortable clothing is a must. Pros: -Great fit. Perfect fit on the arms, nice and loose around the chest and elastic on the waist. -pockets in the back are handy -deep zipper allows me to cool off during a ride -wicking material keeps me dry Cons: -fabric "picks", this is the type of fabric that picks on any sharp object or velcro -the white is slightly see through This is a 4 star bargain of a product. My suggestion would to be buy one and try it. Then buy 5 more
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good cycling shirt
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, great style. Couple feedback for improvement: 1) the 3 pockets in the back of the cycling short could be better if one of them had a zipper or velcro, so I know what I put in there will be secured; 2) I noticed that there was some mild discoloration when I hand washed it. The 1st hand wash discolored the most, so I would not put it in the washer with other clothes. It doesn't discolor now and the red still looks pretty good. I have ordered the long sleeve one to ride in the Fall.
customer_reviews.author: KWLVT

customer_reviews.title: Fits and feels great
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the price, especially compared to my Pearl and Giro jerseys. This one I thought competed nicely with either of them. The fit was great. I have a longer torso and the XXL actually fits longer on me than my Giro of the same size. Maybe there is some difference in the ultimate performance of the fabric, I don't know, but I had no complaints whatsoever after using it on a 30 mile ride. Have not tried the shorts they give you a great discount on when you buy the jersey. Trying a shorter ride to get my impressions on them.
customer_reviews.author: MeanGreen

customer_reviews.title: BRIGHT!
customer_reviews.text: These are great shirts for a great price. I bought in yellow and orange. Frankly, think I can be spotted from outer space they are so bright. Exactly what I was looking for. Fit and craftsmanship match the other comments.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Great for biking and running
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a gift. It's my first official biking shirt, and I really like it for both biking and running. Snug elastic waist keeps it in place, pocket on the back for phone or keys, and a nice fit. The material is great especially on HOT days, when you'll really appreciate how it wicks away sweat.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT SPEND $80 ON A BIKE JERSEY!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn some seriously expensive jerseys over the years and these compare to those for a quarter of the price!! These are comfortable, breathable, 3 pockets on the back, and fit nicely! I don't know if I'll ever buy a jersey from anywhere else! Do yourself a favor and check it out! Note: I don't work for this company nor am I affiliated with marketing for anyone including Amazon. Just a regular guy who really loves these jerseys.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Butler

customer_reviews.title: Update Cycle shirt
customer_reviews.text: Update from previous review -- sleeves ride up and it is uncomfortable. I pulled sleeves down and they ride up all the way. Fits good, good wicking material, zipper ok, only bad area are the sleeves and this is a huge discomfort when riding over 25 miles. Initial review below: For the price -- this shirt feels awesome. I used during a training ride and it felt good, breathable and wick sweat away easily. True to size
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must be kid sizes
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fairly big guy, 5'11 and around 260. I read all the reviews and saw that this jersey ran large so I ordered the 3xl hoping this would be the jersey that finally fits. Not even close. It might fit someone about 160, not my size. Very disappointing that there isn't a company making affordable jerseys for guys with wide shoulders. I guess I'll have to go back to aerotech and spend the $ in order to get a jersey that fits normal dudes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M

customer_reviews.title: My first cycling jersey; is excellent for me.
customer_reviews.text: I am fairly new to cycling for exercise, though I've ridden off and on all my life. That said, I am doing it fairly regularly and wanted a shirt with high visibility as well as functionality. For me this does all I need. I like the longer tail, with the stretchy waist band. The three pockets on the back are deep and held my id and keys without issue. I felt no rubbing, anywhere, and the shirt stayed down while riding. Finally, the zipper works fine and opens fairly deep for ventilation. I don't know much, but this one works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nobody Special

customer_reviews.title: The jersey is quite nice, though getting on (or more particularly off) can ...
customer_reviews.text: The jersey is quite nice, though getting on (or more particularly off) can be annoying, in general it's comfortable on the ride. The elastic at the bottom keeps it from riding up (important for a guy with severe plumber's crack). The pocket in the back is really handy, and is actually 2 pockets, one on the left and one on the right. It is rather tight, though I am broad shouldered. Note that it is totally see-through.... I end up wearing a shirt underneath just because. Kind of limits the "breathability" of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Incredible bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Just received my jersey, I’m 6’1 225lbs and a little beefy, the XL size fits perfect and very comfortably. Very light moist wicking material, storage pockets are awesome and the overall quality for this price point is supreme — only drawback is that it had an actual tag even though it says it doesn’t, went ahead and cut it with some scissors (so no big deal).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Go one size down from US Tshirt size
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected after reading that they are not American sizes and run small. I usually wear an XL tshirt and cycling jersey, but bought this one in XXL and it fits well. It does a fine job of wicking sweat away, has 3 sizable pockets for energy bars/gels, and valuables. The pockets don't fit larger phones like my iPhone 7 Plus very well, the top sticks out and I don't feel comfortable keeping it there. The long zipper stays in place but adjusts easily, and allows for plenty of ventilation if open up.
customer_reviews.author: Trent Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Bright!
customer_reviews.text: This product is well made, and as advertised. I took others suggestions and ordered a size too large, which fits me well (260 lbs, 6'2" USA male). The moisture wicking properties are real, I have been comfortable on hot days. I am impressed by how bright orange this jersey is... There has been some slight pilling of the fabric as I've machine-washed it on a gentle cycle a few times. Otherwise a great value!
customer_reviews.author: S. Keightley

customer_reviews.title: Great jersey but a little short
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint with this jersey was the length. I'm tall (6'4") ~195lbs and purchased the large. It was just a little too short and had a gap between shorts and shirt. I might have been able to alleviate the issue by getting an XL but didn't want a baggy shirt. I went on a decently long tour recently and this shirt did hold up just fine. No issues with quality or comfort.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value!
customer_reviews.text: Hi-viz color? Check. Breathable fabric? Check. Three back pockets? Check. Gripper hem? Check. Reflective graphics? Check. For only $19.99!!!!!! Liked it so much, I ordered another color right away. I’m 6’ and around 192 lbs. Have an L and XL. Both fit but prefer the L—“bright and tight.”
customer_reviews.author: Shutterbug

customer_reviews.title: Great Jersey
customer_reviews.text: Nice jersey and a good value. I really like the dual-layer fabric. I'm 6'-1" tall, 170# and the Large size fits me perfectly. Back pockets are large enough to hold a 30 ounce sports bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Owl

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Effective Jersey
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with this jersey. It's very breathable and does not collect sweat. I needed many jerseys so I wanted something that wouldn't break the bank. I also like the simple design as I prefer not to look like a NASCAR car. I got a small and it fits well. I'm 5'10" with a chest size around 37" and a 32" waist. I do have to be a bit careful taking it off, as it is a snug fit.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C.

customer_reviews.title: No sweat
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a 13mi ride in 85+ degrees without any shade. Came home looked in the mirror and saw ZERO sweat anywhere in this shirt. Normally it looks like I was dunked in a pool after a ride. I’m very satisfied and would purchase again. The back pockets are great for my phone. I don’t use those gel packs because they are awful for you but for a phone and chapstick it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Waldherr

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Bike Jersey
customer_reviews.text: This jersey is comfortable. I am 5'9", 155lbs and the large fits me perfectly. I've used it for over a decent amount (but only one ride over 30 miles) and it is holding up well even after at least 15 washes. The pockets are high quality, allowing me to take what I want with me without worrying the contents will fall out or rip the pockets. Very happy with this jersey!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought two last year and have worn them at least once a week since, including a 67 mile ride that had two hours in the dark. They are super comfortable and the pockets work great, the color (Yellow and Orange) hasn't faded from sun or washing. Great quality and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shirt, Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I did not want to purchase one of the more expensive bike shirts and this one was at the perfect price point for me. It feels me well and I am 6'4" 220lbs (I got the 2XL). The pockets work great. I would and probably will buy another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: A little smaller than expected, but a great shirt at a great value
customer_reviews.text: Love the shirt. Do get a size larger than you might expect unless you like a tighter fit. Got this last week and took it on a 92-mile bike ride a couple of days later--it held up extremely well. The tail stayed down over my butt despite it being a little smaller than I expected. It's light enough that it felt almost as cool zipped up as unzipped (it was about 90 degrees on my ride with a dew point in the 70s--VERY humid). Given the price for most cycling jerseys these days it's hard to go wrong with a shirt this nice at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Grierson

customer_reviews.title: Sizing wrong
customer_reviews.text: I have previously order this shirt in yellow, and fit was good. I ordered this shirt in the same size, and it is way too large.
customer_reviews.author: granthas

customer_reviews.title: Had to order two sizes larger as recommended by my bike buddies as these shirt run smaller ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to order two sizes larger as recommended by my bike buddies as these shirt run smaller than normal sizing. But, other than that it fits nicely. Very comfortable, almost like not having a shirt on at all. It lives up to sweat barrier, adv., living Fl, heat and humidity are always with us. Zipper front works quite ell, easy to operate, no hanging up on the track So far so good. Most likely purchase another shirt in the near futuer.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Del Vero

customer_reviews.title: A Jersey So Nice I Purchased It Thrice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in white, and loved it so much I bought two more in yellow and red. Follow the size guideline and you'll be fine--the fit is fantastic. Most jerseys pull up and show too much back. If I had a tramp stamp it would be on display for all to see. Not this jersey. Keeps my skin under wraps like it's supposed to be. Comfortable in extreme heat. For the price you can't beat it. Buy this jersey, you'll be glad you did!
customer_reviews.author: K. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: The Jersey is great! The material and workmanship is 1st class
customer_reviews.text: The Jersey is great! The material and workmanship is 1st class. I especially like the back pockets which are deep enough and with good elastic closure. The sizing is definitively small, I would say by at least one full size. The X-L was comfortable, but snug on my 180 Lb, 5'-9" frame.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why pay more?
customer_reviews.text: I've been riding for years. And over those years I've almost never paid less than $50 for a jersey. However, after paying half that price I'll never spend that much again. This is an excellent jersey. Spend $50 - $75 for only one jersey if you wish; I'll buy 2 - 3 of these for the same money and ride just as comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: JimiHendrix

customer_reviews.title: Nice shirt, but hard to get off and lower quality zipper.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, basic cycling shirt. I like the plain design. However, because it is a quarter zip it is harder to get off. I have worn it three times. Only washed, air dried. The zipper is starting to catch. I guess it is a lower quality zipper.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Wininger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with the way this shirt looks and fits. I did order the next size up as suggested by other reviewers, but suspect I would have been just as well off with my normal size. It would have just been slightly more snug. The construction is well done and I couldn't find any sharp seams or threads that would cause me grief during the rides. I won't hesitate ordering more of these shirts.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hofman

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with the jersey
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with the jersey. I normally wear a large shirt but experience has taught me to go up a size with these Asian bike clothes. I went up to Xl and the fit was perfect in the chest, arms and shoulders. It does seem a little long in the back but I'm 5' 10" so maybe it's just me. I just roll up the shirt a little and it's fine. Very lightweight and breathable material. Looks exactly like you see in the picture with the hi-viz yellow. Very happy with the purchase after wearing it one time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Medium is medium
customer_reviews.text: The medium fits as a fairly tight, form-fitting medium on my 6'-2" skinny frame, but ok for me. The length is good for my long torso. If you like a looser fit, probably go up a size. The orange is very bright, but not quite neon. Would order again.
customer_reviews.author: Chet Nimitz

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable Price, but...
customer_reviews.text: I own three of these, nice and durable, wach them every week, however, this last one came with a sticky zipper, maybe the quality is degrading. Does run small, I am normally L, but had to jump to XXL to get a comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.author: Floridian

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Breathes well, and has easy access to rear pockets. Not as tight around the arms which is a plus for me. If you carry when you ride there is some imprinting, enough to where you can see the buckle of my support strap, but not sheer enough to where you can physically see my edc.
customer_reviews.author: Cj

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me, but it is orange
customer_reviews.text: Truly a perfect jersey for me. I wear a large T-shirt and this fits me just right, ever so slightly than a T-shirt would. The mesh works really well coming from someone who sweats a lot, and I really appreciate having elastic at the waist/hips but not on the arms. Incidentally this shirt is not red at all. It's orange, but a nice vibrant orange without being flourescent or looking ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Witchbutter

customer_reviews.title: Great warm weather jersey.
customer_reviews.text: For the money, I think this is a really good value. It's a comfortable jersey for warm weather cycling. In the winter I wear insulating layers under it for warmth which negatively affects the fit and my ability to retrieve snacks from the pockets, but the item is intended for warm weather so I can't fault it for that. Just know that you may have the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Triple B

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Biking Jersey
customer_reviews.text: I’m a L leaning towards xl and this fits great. This is my 2nd Spotti Jersey. My 1st was neon green that I used most days on bike ride from WA to ME. It held up great and will dry fast if hand washed but also had no problem throwing it in the dryer. Mine didn’t shrink at all.
customer_reviews.author: John T

customer_reviews.title: Muffin tops beware!
customer_reviews.text: I really, REALLY liked this Jersey. I ordered a size larger than I normally wear just in case. Well, it arrived and was close fighting, but comfortable. Except the bottom. The bottom hem has tight elastic and will really accentuate a muffin top if you have one. Exchanging for an even larger size in hopes that the elastic bottom is a little looser.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Jo Stewart

customer_reviews.title: good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I would give it 5 stars but the collar is flemsy not well finish and size tends to run bigger I ordered a xl but I could fit on a large also took forever to get it two weeks & few days but I guess for the price they are ok.
customer_reviews.author: Humberto Anselmi

customer_reviews.title: Cool and snug fit
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great cycle jersey for me. The snug waist fit means the shirt does not ride up - but it is a bit worky to get it off! Dries quick which also means it cools you. Highly recommnded
customer_reviews.author: R. Nadel

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, works well
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great cycling shirt that has worked it's way to the top of the pile since I've gotten it. I like the silicone band at the bottom to keep it from creeping up. I also appreciate the 3/4 zipper, tho it can be a bit of a pain to take off if you're sweating.
customer_reviews.author: Erik E. Lindgren

customer_reviews.title: Quality seems very good on first blush
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this last week and took it for a short spin last Sunday. I'm 6'2" and about 185 lbs., and the medium size fits perfectly. Quality seems very good on first blush. Rear pockets are voluminous (carried my iPhone SE on the ride with no problem), and the material feels adequately breathable; I'll know more on this last point if it ever warms up here. So far, I'm very pleased with this purchase and feel that it was a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Heat Miser

customer_reviews.title: Best cycling shirts I have purchased
customer_reviews.text: I love this shirt. Previously I purchased 2 of the long-sleeve versions and really love them. So I decided to try the short sleeve ones. They are great. And the seller is great too. Very proactive and wants to make sure I like the shirt. What I love the most about the long-sleeve and short-sleeve shirts is the high visibility and it is very breathable! The shirts fit great for me. They are snug, but not tight.
customer_reviews.author: gm-nc

customer_reviews.title: I love the jersey
customer_reviews.text: Watch the sizing, as the measurements not the letter size is what you will want. I love the jersey. It is soft and fits well. Three pockets in the back keep things organized. I liked the longer length in the back and the elastic around the waist. I washed mine the first time and there was no fade or bleeding onto other things in the wash.
customer_reviews.author: B. Thacker

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Biking Shirt
customer_reviews.text: This is great biking shirt both fit and style. Like the fact that it is not like some of the other shirts out there with the wild colors or multi stripped shirts that so many of the other biking attire competitors have out there. Sometime less is actually more. It is perfect for the biker who rides for pleasure and exercise, and is not competing in a bike race.
customer_reviews.author: CDayGreenBay

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service and Great Jersey
customer_reviews.text: Great customer service. Love the personal touch by Spotti. Originally, they sent a long sleeve in error, but I liked it so much, I kept it and ordered another short sleeve. It's just a great, low priced jersey. I put it on and my wife immediately said, "Oh, I like that. That's different from anything you have." She is right. It fits very well. I love the zipper and its long length. It fits very well and the pockets are huge in the back and can store lots of what I need. I'm truly amazed this shirt is so inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Payton

customer_reviews.title: Great Cycling Jersey for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have worn this Jersey about a dozen times now. Overall good fit. I'm 5' 9" and 208 lbs and bought the XL. I could probably fit into the large and it would have that skin tight fit that many like, but I prefer just a little bit of room and this size accomplished that. Material is very light and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Moisture wicking.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my jersey for about 6 weeks now. I ride about 3 times a week in the 20 to 25-mile range. I live in Georgia which is very humid in the summer. The moisture wicking properties are really appreciated. I like that it is a very vibrant color. On country roads, it increases my visibility for quite a ways. The elastic around the waist does take a bit of getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Nich Wittenmyer

customer_reviews.title: The price is right!
customer_reviews.text: Great cycling jersey! Fits perfect and like the way it snugs the waistline when you are riding. It does not ride up when riding. It is very breathable so no issues with sweating. I ordered a large and it fit as expected. I wish the sleeves were a little bit longer but it's not a deal breaker. The price is perfect no need to to spend more money on the high priced jerseys. Highly recommend! 🚵‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: ana z.

customer_reviews.title: If you're going to wear this you need to be build like the person in the ad
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 sizes larger based on reviews. If you're going to wear this you need to be build like the person in the ad. If you have any stomach fat, you will scare small children. The jersey fits me now since losing more weight, but the length of the shirt is way too long just so it will fit my chest and stomach. Length would be good if I was like 6'4".
customer_reviews.author: Marty Burke

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality, but not great
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these jerseys and they feel great and all that, but the zippers suck. I have had one get stuck completely with nothing in its track, and the other is just hard to zip.
customer_reviews.author: JoeD

customer_reviews.title: Crazy tight at the bottom
customer_reviews.text: The bottom of this shirt is so tight I can’t wear it comfortably. I have other bike jerseys and they are elastic at the bottom and nowhere as tight as this. Otherwise, nice material and price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent jersey for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Started getting back in to biking after a 4 year hiatus due to a leg injury. When I found that my old jerseys had mysteriously shrunk it was time for some new ones. They are very comfortable and fit well, have a good sized back pocket for the snacks and goodies, and the colors are very visible. You cant beat the price, around 20.00. A great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Ghost Of The Great Highway

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, well made and very VISIBLE.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for safety reasons and have been pleased with the fit and durability. I actually bought two more so I can always have a clean on when I ride. Good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Beastmaster

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality Shirt - But Very (Very) Snug
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice quality shirt as others have indicated. Note they are sized really (really) small, at least for my body type. I ordered one size up and even that was too snug.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic price for a great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jersey when I first got introduced to road biking. It’s been over 6 months now and I will be buying more. It is exactly as advertised and is comfortable and the perfect price. You can buy expensive jerseys if you want, but this one will do the same job as the more expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great cycling jersey. Also purchased 4ucycling jerseys but the quality and material is much better quality on these jerseys. I normally wear a large shirt but based on their sizing chart ordered x-large and the x-large fits very comfortably. Excellent product, buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: CharlieKnows

customer_reviews.title: Spotti athletic top, perfect
customer_reviews.text: The Spotti athletic top was even nicer than it looked in the photo, my husband was thrilled with the brilliant orange color, visibility is important to bicyclists, this was great quality and reasonable price, received promptly as well.
customer_reviews.author: Caseyboy

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Nice Zipper
customer_reviews.text: A lot of cycling jerseys on Amazon at low prices. The stitching has been really decent as well as the fabric. The zipper is the Achilles heel where they save costs. Because these are quarter zip, they aren’t near as vulnerable to breakage. These are decently made and bright, visible colors.
customer_reviews.author: The Batman

customer_reviews.title: Not true to color
customer_reviews.text: The image makes this look like a burnt orange... but this is most definitely a bright orange. Fit and comfort are fine... but would not have bought if I knew it was bright orange.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Order one size smaller than you normally do
customer_reviews.text: Great jersey for the money. The fit is why it only got four stars. Normally jerseys fit small, these fit large. I appreciate having to only order a medium, but beware if you order your normal size as it will not fit correctly. The jersey also fit a bit long, but that could just be that the large was a bit too big.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Tillson

customer_reviews.title: It fits!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a 6/19/20 update. When I originally wrote this review, I thought I had ordered a 2XL from Spotti and was excited that it fit better than the 2XL's I'd ordered from other companies. Turns out this was a 3XL, which explains the good fit (and again, I'm 6-3, 245). On the other hand, I just received a 3XL from Strgao, and while I'll keep it, it doesn't fit as well as this one. So if you're a larger guy, Spotti works for comfort, other brands might be a bit wilder with the styles.
customer_reviews.author: SonOfShakes

customer_reviews.title: On the small side
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a medium, 40 or 38 size sport coat. I bought a medium in the jersey and its tight / form fitted. On the aspirational side of sizing Took for a ride this am anyway, rally like it. Felt good, pockets held whatever I put in there without bouncing around. Follow thendir croons to get sizing right and I'd say it's a winner
customer_reviews.author: D. Gale

customer_reviews.title: A bit small for a bigger guy.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bigger guy. Im getting into cycling now. Used to be a bodybuilder etc. So, the XXL is still really tight on my arms and neck. Get a bigger size if you're a bigger guy.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Pelott

customer_reviews.title: Newbies getting into Cycling - Start here
customer_reviews.text: Cycling isn't a cheap man's sport, but that doesn't mean you have to over spend for the essentials. This is a great inexpensive jersey, fits well to size and the pockets are typical and useful as any jersey. I love the choice of all black because I'm am not the type to want to draw attention with his attire. Overall great find for good cycling gear.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: great shirt
customer_reviews.text: I followed the suggested size chart and really like the fit. I didn't want a super tight fit, I wanted one that was a bit looser and I got exactly what I expected for the size I chose. Liked it so much I purchased 2 more. They are my go-to daily use jerseys.
customer_reviews.author: Joe in MO

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I don't like spending a lot of money for clothing im just going to get drenched in sweat. Very comfortable and breathable. I will definitely buy another when I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Nanik

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hot days with arm sun protection
customer_reviews.text: I love this jersey. For longer rides, (30 miles +) I want sun protection on my arms. I prefer a jersey with sleeves over the separate add-on sleeves because they stay in place better. I particularly like the length of the sleeves because they are long and fit nicely into the top of gloves. With other long sleeve jerseys, I need to wear a sweat band to cover this area. I also like the fact the jersey is long enough to stay put on the back side.
customer_reviews.author: Randall F.

customer_reviews.title: not a great fit
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item. It wasn't a great fit. What I disliked was the rubber band on the bottom, which was a bit tight and just didn't work for me on looks either. Material seems good but never tried during sport.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Danke

customer_reviews.title: wish I had paid more attention ...
customer_reviews.text: to the picture of the jersey. Stupid me. It is obviously a partial zippered jersey which makes it a pain to take off when sweaty. But I do love the lightweight fabric, the single side seam, and the price. Wish they made a full length zipper version.
customer_reviews.author: subtropical_ken

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this awhile before I reviewed it. I must say I am impressed with this jersey. It has held up well and it's bright color (orange) is excellent for visibility. It is comfortable and I would buy again. I am 6'5" 200lbs and I got the US XL and it fits well. If in doubt go ahead and give them a try. I think you will be pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Thee Kid

customer_reviews.title: 3XL size - way to small for big man
customer_reviews.text: I was thinking that 3XL would fit me for someone who is 250 lbs and waist size 42. Shirt is way tooo small. Not sure if these are chinese sizes. Need to return
customer_reviews.author: SpeedRacer

customer_reviews.title: Rides up in the back, could be longer
customer_reviews.text: Great shirt for the price, no logos, just a good clean looking shirt. It does ride up in the back a bit so I wish it was a bit longer. it performes like all good sports wear, wicks the moisture away while allowing air flow.
customer_reviews.author: S.R.

customer_reviews.title: Fits great
customer_reviews.text: Fits great, only complaint is if you get sweaty its tight so it's hard to get off. Wish I had gotten one with zipper all the way down to avoid having to hunchover to take it off from sweat.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan
